snippet.title: The robot that acts like Keanu Reeves
snippet.description: Researchers in England have been working on robot that can skillfully mimic facial expressions. The only problem is that its expressions are in the range of Keanu Reeves'.

snippet.title: All six 'Star Wars' films coming to Blu-ray
snippet.description: Road Trip 2010: At Celebration V in Orlando, Fla., George Lucas said that all six live-action movies will be coming out in the high-definition format in 2011.

snippet.title: Plane crashes, woman dies, survivor films and takes selfie
snippet.description: A month after a small plane crash in Hawaii, a surviving passenger shows GoPro footage and even a selfie taken during the ordeal.

snippet.title: Harry Potter spinoff films to get game adaptations
snippet.description: Just-announced movies based on "Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them" will be spun into video games from Warner Bros.

snippet.title: Sundance films take on Net addiction, life of Aaron Swartz
snippet.description: Several documentaries competing in the upcoming Sundance Film Festival pan in on tech's darker sides.

snippet.title: Family films as lightning strikes car, recharges phones
snippet.description: When one of your kids says, "I hope we get struck by lightning" and then you are, you'd better be filming. This footage offers the scary realities of getting nature to knock your car out, while recharging your gadgets.

snippet.title: Five great zombie short films you can watch online
snippet.description: Crave celebrates the return of "The Walking Dead" with a roundup of great zombie shorts available for your viewing pleasure on YouTube and Vimeo.

snippet.title: Disney exec: Standalone 'Star Wars' films will be 'origin' stories
snippet.description: Though Disney hasn't said much about the forthcoming group of "Star Wars" films, it appears likely they will focus on the back stories of major characters, including possibly Han Solo and Yoda.

snippet.title: Netflix inks exclusive deal for first-run Weinstein films
snippet.description: The Internet's biggest on-demand video service will stream movies from the indie film studio before any other pay-TV providers starting in 2016, the same year it kicks off a similar Disney deal.

snippet.title: Walt Disney, Sony Pictures test rentals of in-theater films
snippet.description: The companies allow customers in South Korea to rent films that are still playing in theaters, but it's unclear if the test will expand to other countries.
